jparsec.graph.chartRendering

Class SkyRenderElement

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.graph.chartRendering.SkyRenderElement
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class SkyRenderElement
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A class to instantiate an adequate object for sky rendering operations. The constructor allows to instantiate an object selecting the values of the main fields. There are much more variables (any variable name starting with draw...) that can be set optionally.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      The set of options to draw fast lines for better performance.

      The set of options to draw texture at horizon.

      The set of values to select how to draw labels.

      The set of textures for the milky way.

      The set of values to select the kind of realistic stars to render.
      static class  SkyRenderElement.STAR_LABELS
      The set of options to draw star labels.
      static class  SkyRenderElement.SUPERIMPOSED_LABELS
      The set of values to select how to draw labels.

      Sets coordinate grid color.

      Stroke to draw deep sky objects.

      Set whether to draw or not the real images of the deep sky objects on the sky for reduced fields of view.
      boolean[] drawExternalCatalogs
      Default value is null, which means that all external catalogs defined will be shown.
      boolean drawExternalGrid
      Set whether to draw or not the square containing the rendering with the outer labels.

      True to draw stars beyond magnitude 10 (Internet connection required).

      Timeout to query UCAC3 catalog in seconds.
      SkyRenderElement.SUPERIMPOSED_LABELS drawFastLabels
      Selects to draw labels in a fast way or trying to reduce label superimposing.
      boolean drawFastLabelsInWideFields
      True to draw labels in a fast way when the field of view is greater than 100 degrees.
      SkyRenderElement.FAST_LINES drawFastLinesMode
      Set if fast lines mode will be used to render coordinate grid and constellations.
      SkyRenderElement.HORIZON_TEXTURE drawHorizonTexture
      Selects the texture to draw at horizon, none by default.
      boolean drawIcons
      True to draw icons for planets, probes, ...

      Holds the leyend position, top by default.

      Set whether to draw or not the radians of meteor showers.

      Color attribute for drawing meteor showers.

      Set to false to show all showers, true (default value) for those active currently.

      Set whether to draw or not the stars using different symbols for variable and double types.

      Set whether to draw or not transNeptunian objects.
      boolean drawWithAntialiasing
      True to use antialiasing to increasing rendering quality.
      boolean enableTransparentColors
      Set to false to disable transparent colors (for printing).

      The color to fill a globular cluster.

      The color to fill an open cluster.

      Holds screen height in pixels.

      Holds hour_angle.
      float limitOfDifferenceOfMagnitudesForVariableStars
      Minimum difference of magnitudes in a variable star to draw it as a variable.
      float limitOfSeparationForDoubleStars
      Minimum separation in arcseconds of a double star to draw it as a double.
      float maxAllowedMovementPixels
      Sets maximum allowed error in pixels when drawing stars.
      static java.lang.String[] MILKY_WAY_TEXTURE_FILENAME
      Holds the filenames for the different Milky Way textures.
      boolean overlayDSSimageInNextRendering
      Set this flag to true to overlay an DSS image in the next rendering.
      PlanetRenderElement planetRender
      Holds planetary rendering properties.
      float poleAngle
      Holds the direction of the pole in the current projection, angle in radians.
      Projection.PROJECTION projection
      Holds projection type.
      TelescopeElement telescope
      Holds the selected telescope.
      TrajectoryElement[] trajectory
      Holds properties of a custom defined trajectory path to show.
      float updateTime
      The time interval to update the ephemerides of everything when rendering the sky in real-time mode.
      float updateTimeFullUpdate
      The time interval to update everything except ephemerides when rendering the sky in real-time mode.
      boolean useSuperScriptForRA
      Set to false (default is true) to avoid using superscript for labeling right ascension, which is something only supported in desktop mode.
      int width
      Holds screen width in pixels.

    • Field Detail

      • width

        public int width
        Holds screen width in pixels.

      • height

        public int height
        Holds screen height in pixels.

      • centralLongitude

        public double centralLongitude
        Holds screen central position in coordinate longitude in radians. Can be set for either equatorial, horizontal, ecliptic, or galactic coordinates.

      • centralLatitude

        public double centralLatitude
        Holds screen central position in coordinate latitude in radians. Can be set for either equatorial, horizontal, ecliptic, or galactic coordinates.

      • projection

        public Projection.PROJECTION projection
        Holds projection type.

      • poleAngle

        public float poleAngle
        Holds the direction of the pole in the current projection, angle in radians. Rotation is towards east if no vertical inversion is applied in the telescope object, which means that +PI/2 will show the west region upwards.

      • hourAngle

        public float hourAngle
        Holds hour_angle.

      • coordinateSystem

        public CoordinateSystem.COORDINATE_SYSTEM coordinateSystem
        Holds coordinate system.

      • planetRender

        public PlanetRenderElement planetRender
        Holds planetary rendering properties.

      • telescope

        public TelescopeElement telescope
        Holds the selected telescope.

      • trajectory

        public TrajectoryElement[] trajectory
        Holds properties of a custom defined trajectory path to show.

      • enableTransparentColors

        public boolean enableTransparentColors
        Set to false to disable transparent colors (for printing). Default value is true.

      • drawConstellationContours

        public SkyRenderElement.CONSTELLATION_CONTOUR drawConstellationContours
        Set whether to draw or not constellations and which set of lines. Default value is the JPARSEC set of lines (for Western culture).

      • drawConstellationLimits

        public boolean drawConstellationLimits
        Set whether to draw or not constellations limits.

      • drawConstellationNames

        public boolean drawConstellationNames
        Set whether to draw or not constellation names.

      • drawConstellationNamesUppercase

        public boolean drawConstellationNamesUppercase
        Set whether to draw or not constellation names in upper case.

      • drawConstellationNamesType

        public Constellation.CONSTELLATION_NAME drawConstellationNamesType
        Set which constellation names to show. This only takes effect when the set of constellation lines is the default JPARSEC one, otherwise the names of the constellations for the different cultures are available only in Spanish or English.

      • drawCoordinateGrid

        public boolean drawCoordinateGrid
        Set whether to draw or not coordinate grid.

      • drawCoordinateGridHighZoom

        public boolean drawCoordinateGridHighZoom
        Set whether to draw or not detailed coordinate grid with high zoom.

      • drawExternalGrid

        public boolean drawExternalGrid
        Set whether to draw or not the square containing the rendering with the outer labels.

      • drawCoordinateGridEcliptic

        public boolean drawCoordinateGridEcliptic
        Set whether to draw or not the ecliptic when rendering sky in other coordinate systems, such as equatorial, galactic, or horizontal.

      • drawCoordinateGridEclipticLabels

        public boolean drawCoordinateGridEclipticLabels
        Set whether to draw or not the numeric labels for the ecliptic when rendering sky in other coordinate systems, such as equatorial, galactic, or horizontal.

      • drawStars

        public boolean drawStars
        Set whether to draw or not the stars.

      • drawNebulaeContours

        public boolean drawNebulaeContours
        Set whether to draw or not nebula.

      • drawMeteorShowers

        public boolean drawMeteorShowers
        Set whether to draw or not the radians of meteor showers. Default is false.

      • drawMeteorShowersOnlyActive

        public boolean drawMeteorShowersOnlyActive
        Set to false to show all showers, true (default value) for those active currently. In case this flag is flase, current active showers will be rendered without alpha color component, and labels in bold face. In any case most intense showers will be rendered using a stroke with greater width.

      • drawMilkyWayContours

        public boolean drawMilkyWayContours
        Set whether to draw or not Milky Way.

      • fillMilkyWay

        public boolean fillMilkyWay
        Set if Milky Way should be filled.

      • fillNebulae

        public boolean fillNebulae
        Set if nebula should be filled. Note that sky rendering is usually faster when filling nebula.

      • drawMilkyWayContoursWithTextures

        public SkyRenderElement.MILKY_WAY_TEXTURE drawMilkyWayContoursWithTextures
        Set whether to draw or not Milky Way with textures.

      • drawDeepSkyObjects

        public boolean drawDeepSkyObjects
        Set whether to draw or not deep sky objects.

      • drawDeepSkyObjectsTextures

        public boolean drawDeepSkyObjectsTextures
        Set whether to draw or not the real images of the deep sky objects on the sky for reduced fields of view.

      • drawDeepSkyObjectsOnlyMessier

        public boolean drawDeepSkyObjectsOnlyMessier
        Set whether to draw or not only Messier deep sky objects.

      • drawDeepSkyObjectsAllMessierAndCaldwell

        public boolean drawDeepSkyObjectsAllMessierAndCaldwell
        Set whether to draw or not all Messier deep sky objects, even in case their magnitudes are fainter that the limiting magnitude. Default value is true. This also includes all Caldwell objects.

      • drawDeepSkyObjectsLabels

        public boolean drawDeepSkyObjectsLabels
        Set whether to draw or not labels for deep sky objects.

      • drawStarsColors

        public boolean drawStarsColors
        Set whether to draw or not the stars using different colors for spectral types. Only applied in case the background is not white.

      • drawStarsRealistic

        public SkyRenderElement.REALISTIC_STARS drawStarsRealistic
        Select if stars should be rendered in a realistic way (using textures) or not. Symbols for double and variable stars will not be drawn if something different from NONE is selected. Default value is NONE.

      • drawStarsColor

        public int drawStarsColor
        Set the color for stars, only when drawStarsColors is false; This will be also the color for the planets in intermediate fields, when they appear as little disks.

      • drawStarsSymbols

        public boolean drawStarsSymbols
        Set whether to draw or not the stars using different symbols for variable and double types.

      • drawStarsPositionAngleInDoubles

        public boolean drawStarsPositionAngleInDoubles
        Set whether to draw or not the orientation of the double star in its symbol. False as default, resulting in an horizontal line.

      • drawStarsLimitingMagnitude

        public float drawStarsLimitingMagnitude
        Set limiting magnitude for stars. Default value is 7.5, and the minimum value to show all constellation lines is 5.3. If it is set to a magnitude fainter than 10, and the field of view is lower than 1 degree, then the remaining stars will be drawn using USNO-B1 catalog, by calling Vizier database (only if Internet connection is available). If the limit is 12.0 or brighter, and fainter than 10, Karchenko's catalog will be used instead due to speed considerations. In this case, a field limit of 3 degrees will be used.

      • drawObjectsLimitingMagnitude

        public float drawObjectsLimitingMagnitude
        Set limiting magnitude for deep sky objects, natural satellites, comets, and asteroids.

      • drawSuperNovaEvents

        public boolean drawSuperNovaEvents
        Set whether to draw or not Supernova events.

      • drawSuperNovaEventsNumberOfYears

        public int drawSuperNovaEventsNumberOfYears
        Set during how many (Julian) years a SN event would still be visible in the rendering. Default value is 3 years.

      • drawSuperNovaEventsColor

        public int drawSuperNovaEventsColor
        Color attribute for SN.

      • drawDeepSkyObjectsColor

        public int drawDeepSkyObjectsColor
        Color attribute for drawing deep sky objects.

      • drawMeteorShowersColor

        public int drawMeteorShowersColor
        Color attribute for drawing meteor showers.

      • drawConstellationContoursColor

        public int drawConstellationContoursColor
        Color attribute for drawing constellations.

      • drawConstellationLimitsColor

        public int drawConstellationLimitsColor
        Color attribute for drawing constellation limits.

      • drawConstellationNamesColor

        public int drawConstellationNamesColor
        Color attribute for drawing constellation names.

        Color attribute for drawing Milky Way.

      • fillMilkyWayColor

        public int fillMilkyWayColor
        Color attribute to fill Milky Way.

      • fillBrightNebulaeColor

        public int fillBrightNebulaeColor
        Color attribute to fill nebulae. Default value is -1 to use the same color as the nebulae contours.

      • drawCoordinateGridColor

        public int drawCoordinateGridColor
        Sets coordinate grid color.

      • drawCoordinateGridEclipticColor

        public int drawCoordinateGridEclipticColor
        Sets coordinate grid color for the ecliptic.

        Sets Sun spots color.

        Set whether to draw or not the planets, the Moon, and the Sun.

        Set whether to draw or not the labels for planets, the Moon, and the Sun.

        Set what kind of labels should be drawn for stars.

      • drawStarsGreekSymbols

        public boolean drawStarsGreekSymbols
        Set whether to show or not Greek symbols for the stars.

      • drawStarsGreekSymbolsOnlyIfHasProperName

        public boolean drawStarsGreekSymbolsOnlyIfHasProperName
        True to show Greek symbols only if the star has proper name.

      • drawStarsLabelsLimitingMagnitude

        public float drawStarsLabelsLimitingMagnitude
        Set limiting magnitude for stars labels;

      • limitOfSeparationForDoubleStars

        public float limitOfSeparationForDoubleStars
        Minimum separation in arcseconds of a double star to draw it as a double.

      • limitOfDifferenceOfMagnitudesForVariableStars

        public float limitOfDifferenceOfMagnitudesForVariableStars
        Minimum difference of magnitudes in a variable star to draw it as a variable.

      • drawFastLinesMode

        public SkyRenderElement.FAST_LINES drawFastLinesMode
        Set if fast lines mode will be used to render coordinate grid and constellations. This mode allows to draw lines very fast, but without support for strokes and antialiasing. In case of using a stroke with a line width greater than 1 for grid or constellations, this mode is automatically disabled. Default value is NONE.

      • drawConstellationContoursMarginBetweenLineAndStar

        public int drawConstellationContoursMarginBetweenLineAndStar
        This sets the separation between constellation lines and stars. Default value is 20 px. Set to 0 to draw all lines from one star to the other.

      • drawHorizonTexture

        public SkyRenderElement.HORIZON_TEXTURE drawHorizonTexture
        Selects the texture to draw at horizon, none by default.

      • overlayDSSimageInNextRendering

        public boolean overlayDSSimageInNextRendering
        Set this flag to true to overlay an DSS image in the next rendering. This is only allowed when deep sky objects are shown and the field of view is lower than 3 degrees. After the overlay this flag is set to false in Android. Default value is false.

      • MILKY_WAY_TEXTURE_FILENAME

        public static final java.lang.String[] MILKY_WAY_TEXTURE_FILENAME
        Holds the filenames for the different Milky Way textures.

      • drawMinorObjectsLabels

        public boolean drawMinorObjectsLabels
        Set whether to draw or not the labels for asteroids, comets, probes, and artificial satellites.

      • drawAsteroids

        public boolean drawAsteroids
        Set whether to draw or not asteroids.

      • drawComets

        public boolean drawComets
        Set whether to draw or not comets.

      • drawTransNeptunianObjects

        public boolean drawTransNeptunianObjects
        Set whether to draw or not transNeptunian objects.

      • drawArtificialSatellites

        public boolean drawArtificialSatellites
        Set whether to draw or not artificial Earth satellites.

      • drawArtificialSatellitesOnlyThese

        public java.lang.String drawArtificialSatellitesOnlyThese
        Select which satellites to draw (listed by names separated by comma), null to draw all if drawArtificialSatellites is true.

      • drawSpaceProbes

        public boolean drawSpaceProbes
        Set whether to draw or not space probes.

      • drawOcularFieldOfView

        public boolean drawOcularFieldOfView
        Set whether to draw or not the ocular field of view circle.

      • drawCoordinateGridLabels

        public boolean drawCoordinateGridLabels
        Set whether to draw or not coordinate grid labels.

      • drawLeyend

        public SkyRenderElement.LEYEND_POSITION drawLeyend
        Holds the leyend position, top by default. Leyend should only be drawn with at least 800 px of space.

      • drawConstellationNamesFont

        public Graphics.FONT drawConstellationNamesFont
        Sets the font to be used for constellation labels.

      • drawStarsNamesFont

        public Graphics.FONT drawStarsNamesFont
        Sets the font to be used for constellation labels.

      • drawPlanetsNamesFont

        public Graphics.FONT drawPlanetsNamesFont
        Sets the font to be used for planets labels.

      • drawDeepSkyObjectsNamesFont

        public Graphics.FONT drawDeepSkyObjectsNamesFont
        Sets the font to be used for deep sky objects labels.

      • drawMinorObjectsNamesFont

        public Graphics.FONT drawMinorObjectsNamesFont
        Sets the font to be used for comet, asteroid, satellite labels, and meteor showers.

      • drawCoordinateGridFont

        public Graphics.FONT drawCoordinateGridFont
        Sets the font to be used for grid labels.

      • drawCoordinateGridCardinalPoints

        public boolean drawCoordinateGridCardinalPoints
        True (default value) to show N, S, E, and W points in the sky.

      • drawSkyBelowHorizon

        public boolean drawSkyBelowHorizon
        Sets whether to draw or not the sky below the observer's horizon. True as default.

      • drawSkyCorrectingLocalHorizon

        public boolean drawSkyCorrectingLocalHorizon
        Sets whether to correct for refraction in observer's horizon. This also corrects local horizon for depression. Only considered if also drawSkyBelowHorizon is false. False as default.

      • drawSunSpots

        public boolean drawSunSpots
        To draw or not the Sun spots if available for this date. If textures are enabled, solar spots will not be drawn.

      • background

        public int background
        Sets background color. Also the color to fill dark nebula.

      • drawOcularFieldOfViewColor

        public int drawOcularFieldOfViewColor
        The color for the grid used to show the field of view of a telescope.

      • maxAllowedMovementPixels

        public float maxAllowedMovementPixels
        Sets maximum allowed error in pixels when drawing stars. The different necessary corrections for drawing stars accurately will be applied. If it is not possible to draw below this error in pixels, a warning will be thrown.

      • drawNebulaeStroke

        public JPARSECStroke drawNebulaeStroke
        Stroke to draw nebula.

      • drawMilkyWayStroke

        public JPARSECStroke drawMilkyWayStroke
        Stroke to draw Milky Way.

      • drawDeepSkyObjectsStroke

        public JPARSECStroke drawDeepSkyObjectsStroke
        Stroke to draw deep sky objects.

      • drawConstellationStroke

        public JPARSECStroke drawConstellationStroke
        Stroke to draw constellations.

      • drawConstellationLimitsStroke

        public JPARSECStroke drawConstellationLimitsStroke
        Stroke to draw constellation limits.

      • drawCoordinateGridStroke

        public JPARSECStroke drawCoordinateGridStroke
        Stroke to draw coordinate grid.

      • drawFaintStars

        public boolean drawFaintStars
        True to draw stars beyond magnitude 10 (Internet connection required).

      • drawFastLabels

        public SkyRenderElement.SUPERIMPOSED_LABELS drawFastLabels
        Selects to draw labels in a fast way or trying to reduce label superimposing.

      • drawFastLabelsInWideFields

        public boolean drawFastLabelsInWideFields
        True to draw labels in a fast way when the field of view is greater than 100 degrees. Only considered if drawFastLabels is not set to fast mode.

      • drawIcons

        public boolean drawIcons
        True to draw icons for planets, probes, ...

      • drawClever

        public boolean drawClever
        True to hide objects depending on the field of view, in a clever way. Setting this to false will show most objects (but not stars) independently of the field of view, but the disks of planets and satellites will not appear. Note projection is forced to cylindrical for fields of view lower than 30 degrees to show correctly the relative positions of planets, satellites, and stars in case the clever flag is true. True is recommended, false can be useful to construct charts with a given set of data.

      • drawWithAntialiasing

        public boolean drawWithAntialiasing
        True to use antialiasing to increasing rendering quality.

      • fillGalaxyColor

        public int fillGalaxyColor
        The color to fill a galaxy. Set to -1 as default to avoid the fill.

      • fillGlobularColor

        public int fillGlobularColor
        The color to fill a globular cluster. Set to -1 as default to avoid the fill.

      • fillOpenColor

        public int fillOpenColor
        The color to fill an open cluster. Set to -1 as default to avoid the fill.

      • drawFaintStarsTimeOut

        public int drawFaintStarsTimeOut
        Timeout to query UCAC3 catalog in seconds.

      • useSuperScriptForRA

        public boolean useSuperScriptForRA
        Set to false (default is true) to avoid using superscript for labeling right ascension, which is something only supported in desktop mode.

      • anaglyphMode

        public Graphics.ANAGLYPH_COLOR_MODE anaglyphMode
        The anaglyph mode, disabled by default.

      • updateTime

        public float updateTime
        The time interval to update the ephemerides of everything when rendering the sky in real-time mode. Default value is 30s. When time changes less than this value planets and satellites are still updated, but not comets or asteroids.

      • updateTimeFullUpdate

        public float updateTimeFullUpdate
        The time interval to update everything except ephemerides when rendering the sky in real-time mode. Default value is 3600s. Will force the update of everything.

      • drawExternalCatalogs

        public boolean[] drawExternalCatalogs
        Default value is null, which means that all external catalogs defined will be shown. Define the array and set each to true or false to enable/disable each of them.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SkyRenderElement

        public SkyRenderElement()
        Default constructor. Default color model is normal with white background.

      • SkyRenderElement

        public SkyRenderElement(CoordinateSystem.COORDINATE_SYSTEM coord_system,
                Projection.PROJECTION proj,
                double lon0,
                double lat0,
                int w,
                int h,
                PlanetRenderElement pr,
                TelescopeElement tel)
        Explicit constructor. Note that a lot of secondary options (enabled by default) like to draw constellations, nebula, and others like colors should be set after constructing this object. Default color model is normal with white background.
        Parameters:
        coord_system - Coordinate system.
        proj - Projection type.
        lon0 - Central position in the selected system.
        lat0 - Central position in the selected system.
        w - Screen width.
        h - Screen height.
        pr - Planet render object.
        tel - Telescope object.

    • Method Detail

      • addExternalCatalog

        public void addExternalCatalog(java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.String objType,
                      int rgb,
                      java.lang.String path,
                      FileFormatElement[] format)
                        throws JPARSECException
        Adds an external catalog to render certain objects to memory. Since the sky rendering class already takes into account main astronomical objects, the catalog is added as a subset of deep sky objects.
        Parameters:
        name - An identifier or name for this catalog.
        objType - The global name for the type of objects in this catalog.
        rgb - The rgb color to show the objects in this catalog.
        path - The path to the file.
        format - The format. The identifiers for the fields should be set using the symbolic constants in this class. Flux field can be used instead of magnitude to use a logarithmic scale. The angular size can be set in degrees or arcsec, using major/minor values (and the position angle) or the same value for both axes. The coordinates type is a field used to include objects with ecliptic/galactic coordinates instead of equatorial. Valid values in the files are those starting with 'EQ', 'EC', 'GA'. In this case the RA/DEC fields corresponds to ecliptic/galactic longitudes/latitudes. Default equinox is year 2000 if it is not specified. RA/DEC should be mean coordinates referred to a given equinox.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • addExternalCatalog

        public void addExternalCatalog(java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.String objType,
                      int rgb,
                      java.lang.String[] contents,
                      FileFormatElement[] format)
                        throws JPARSECException
        Adds an external catalog to render certain objects to memory. Since the sky rendering class already takes into account main astronomical objects, the catalog is added as a subset of deep sky objects.
        Parameters:
        name - An identifier or name for this catalog.
        objType - The global name for the type of objects in this catalog.
        rgb - The rgb color to show the objects in this catalog.
        contents - The contents of the file.
        format - The format. The identifiers for the fields should be set using the symbolic constants in this class. Flux field can be used instead of magnitude to use a logarithmic scale. The angular size can be set in degrees or arcsec, using major/minor values (and the position angle) or the same value for both axes. The coordinates type is a field used to include objects with ecliptic/galactic coordinates instead of equatorial. Valid values in the files are those starting with 'EQ', 'EC', 'GA'. In this case the RA/DEC fields corresponds to ecliptic/galactic longitudes/latitudes. Default equinox is year 2000 if it is not specified. RA/DEC should be mean coordinates referred to a given equinox.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • addExternalCatalog

        public void addExternalCatalog(java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.String objType,
                      int rgb,
                      java.lang.String[] contents,
                      FileFormatElement[] format,
                      boolean inMemory)
                        throws JPARSECException
        Adds an external catalog to render objects. Since the sky rendering class already takes into account main astronomical objects, the catalog is added as a subset of deep sky objects.
        Parameters:
        name - An identifier or name for this catalog.
        objType - The global name for the type of objects in this catalog.
        rgb - The rgb color to show the objects in this catalog.
        contents - The contents of the file.
        format - The format. The identifiers for the fields should be set using the symbolic constants in this class. Flux field can be used instead of magnitude to use a logarithmic scale. The angular size can be set in degrees or arcsec, using major/minor values (and the position angle) or the same value for both axes. The coordinates type is a field used to include objects with ecliptic/galactic coordinates instead of equatorial. Valid values in the files are those starting with 'EQ', 'EC', 'GA'. In this case the RA/DEC fields corresponds to ecliptic/galactic longitudes/latitudes. Default equinox is year 2000 if it is not specified. RA/DEC should be mean coordinates referred to a given equinox.
        inMemory - True to hold the catalog in memory, false for disk. True is strongly recommended for better performance.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getTotalNumberOfExternalCatalogs

        public static int getTotalNumberOfExternalCatalogs()
        Returns the number of external catalogs defined. Note this is a static value that corresponds to the total number of external catalogs defined in all threads, for a given thread some of those catalogs could be null.
        Returns:
        The number of total external catalogs.

      • getNumberOfExternalCatalogs

        public int getNumberOfExternalCatalogs()
        Returns the number of external catalogs defined in this instance.
        Returns:
        The number of external catalogs for this instance.

      • getNumberOfEnabledExternalCatalogs

        public int getNumberOfEnabledExternalCatalogs()
        Returns the number of external catalogs currently enabled to be shown, and defined in this instance.
        Returns:
        The number of external catalogs currently enabled for this instance.

      • getExternalCatalogName

        public java.lang.String getExternalCatalogName(int index)
        Returns the name of a given external catalog.
        Parameters:
        index - The index, from 0 to getNumberOfExternalCatalogs().
        Returns:
        The name of a given catalog, or null for an invalid index.

      • externalCatalogAvailable

        public boolean externalCatalogAvailable(java.lang.String id)
        Returns if a given catalog id is available for this instance.
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the external catalog.
        Returns:
        True or false.

      • setColorMode

        public void setColorMode(SkyRenderElement.COLOR_MODE id)
        Sets the color model. The colors for the different objects are adjusted. Anaglyph mode should be selected before calling this method.
        Parameters:
        id - Color model id constant.

      • setStarLabelsAccordingtoCurrentLanguage

        public void setStarLabelsAccordingtoCurrentLanguage()
        Sets the star labels to the star names in a given language in case the selected labels are SkyRenderElement.STAR_LABELS.ONLY_PROPER_NAME and the current selected language is different. Currently only change to Spanish proper names is supported.
